events.originalText: A heavy bomber plane that had been unintentionally loaded with nuclear missiles transported them from North Dakota to Louisiana before they were recognized.
events.subtitle: Heavy bomber
events.headline: Nuclear Missiles Transported from North Dakota to Louisiana by Heavy Bomber Plane

events.originalText: German racing driver Michael Schumacher  won the Belgian Grand Prix, the first of his 91 Formula One Grand Prix wins.
events.subtitle: Michael Schumacher
events.headline: Michael Schumacher Wins Belgian Grand Prix for First Formula One Victory

events.originalText: Gulf War: US General Norman Schwarzkopf Jr. issued General Order No. 1 prohibiting US troops from consuming alcohol or possessing pornographic material.
events.subtitle: Gulf War
events.headline: US General Schwarzkopf Jr. Prohibits Troops from Alcohol and Pornography in Gulf War

events.originalText: Discovery, the third orbiter of NASA's Space Shuttle program, lifted off on its maiden voyage from Kennedy Space Center, Florida.
events.subtitle: Space Shuttle Discovery
events.headline: NASA's Space Shuttle Discovery Lifts Off on Maiden Voyage from Kennedy Space Center

events.originalText: An express train carrying foreign workers from Yugoslavia to West Germany derailed in Zagreb, killing 153 people.
events.subtitle: Gastarbeiter
events.headline: Express Train Derails in Zagreb, Killing 153 Foreign Workers from Yugoslavia

events.originalText: Writer and politician Abdul Muis became the first person to be awarded the posthumous title of National Hero of Indonesia.
events.subtitle: Abdul Muis
events.headline: Abdul Muis Awarded Posthumous Title of National Hero of Indonesia

events.originalText: South Vietnamese opposition figure Phan Quang Đán was elected to the National Assembly, despite soldiers being bussed in to vote multiple times for President Ngô Đình Diệm's candidate.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam
events.headline: Phan Quang Đán Elected to National Assembly in South Vietnam Despite Controversy

events.originalText: British and Australian prisoners of war in Singapore revolted against their Japanese captors, who required them to pledge not to escape.
events.subtitle: Prisoner of war
events.headline: British and Australian POWs Revolt Against Japanese Captors in Singapore

events.originalText: Second World War: German field marshal Erwin Rommel launched the last major Axis offensive of the Western Desert campaign, attacking British positions near El Alamein, Egypt.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Field Marshal Rommel Launches Last Major Axis Offensive in Western Desert

events.originalText: World War I: The Battle of Tannenberg resulted in the almost complete destruction of the Russian 2nd Army by the German 8th Army.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Tannenberg Results in Destruction of Russian 2nd Army by German 8th Army

events.originalText: James VI of Scotland held a masque at the baptism of Prince Henry, his first child.
events.subtitle: James VI and I
events.headline: James VI of Scotland Holds Masque at Baptism of Prince Henry

events.originalText: Guru Ram Das (pictured) became the fourth of the Sikh gurus, the spiritual masters of Sikhism.
events.subtitle: Guru Ram Das
events.headline: Guru Ram Das Becomes Fourth Sikh Guru in Sikhism

events.originalText: First Jewish–Roman War: Roman forces led by Titus set fire to the Second Temple during the Siege of Jerusalem.
events.subtitle: AD 70
events.headline: Roman Forces Set Fire to Second Temple During Siege of Jerusalem in First Jewish-Roman War
